availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James Murrell Shackelford (Lincoln County, KY, attorney and soldier)

body.p: Lincoln County, Kentucky, attorney and soldier. Kentucky native. Served in the 4th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment during the U.S.-Mexico War as a second lieutenant and first lieutenant. Attorney in Louisville from c1848 to 1861. Served in the 25th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry as colonel from January 1, 1862 to March 24, 1862. Served in the 8th Kentucky Volunteer Cavalry as colonel from September 13, 1862. Appointed brigadier general of volunteers on January 2, 1863. Commanded forces that captured General John Hunt Morgan at Salineville, Ohio on July 26, 1863.

bibl.hi: American Civil War: The Definitive Encyclopedia and Document Collection [6 Volumes]
